title: On L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Call, Adar Poonawalla Says 'Even My Wife...' - News18
summary:
Adar Poonawalla Responds to L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Suggestion

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: News18

Adar Poonawalla, CEO of Serum Institute of India, recently discussed the importance of work-life balance in response to remarks made by Larsen & Toubro Chairman SN Subrahmanyan advocating for a 90-hour work week.

  • Poonawalla affirmed the need for work-life balance, highlighting his agreement with Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra.
  • Subrahmanyan's suggestion drew significant backlash from various sectors, prompting reactions from industrialists and celebrities.
  • Other leaders echoed the sentiment that extreme work hours could lead to burnout and emphasized the quality of work over quantity.
“Even my wife loves staring at me on Sundays.” - Adar Poonawalla

In conclusion, the debate around work-life balance versus demanding work schedules continues, with Poonawalla and others advocating for the former.
newTitle: Adar Poonawalla Responds to L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Suggestion

title: Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected - Hindustan Times
summary:
Mahakumbh 2025: Underwater drones, AI cameras, NSG commandos part of security detail; over 45 crore visitors expected

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Prayagraj police have made extensive security arrangements for the upcoming Mahakumbh 2025, expecting over 45 crore visitors from January 13 to February 26.

  • Uttar Pradesh Police has established a multi-layered security system including 102 checkpoints along critical routes.
  • Over 1,000 police personnel along with additional security forces will ensure the safety of attendees.
  • Advanced technology such as underwater drones and AI-enabled cameras is being utilized to enhance surveillance.
  • Mock drills conducted in collaboration with the NSG and other security agencies are in place to ensure preparedness.
  • Main bathing rituals will occur on auspicious dates during the event.
“We are committed to ensuring the safety of all participants.” - DGP Prashant Kumar

The Mahakumbh, celebrated once every 12 years, will attract millions to the holy confluence of rivers at Prayagraj.
newTitle: Mahakumbh 2025: Security Measures for Record Number of Visitors

title: Samples of 2 Nagpur kids test positive for HMPV at AIIMS too, but unfit for genome sequencing - The Times of India
summary:
Nagpur Kids Test Positive for HMPV at AIIMS, Not Eligible for Genome Sequencing

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

The recent testing at AIIMS has revealed that two children from Nagpur have tested positive for Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV); however, their samples are deemed unfit for genome sequencing, posing challenges in tracking the virus.

  • Two children from Nagpur confirmed positive for HMPV.
  • Samples not suitable for genome sequencing.
  • Raises concerns about monitoring the virus's strain.
“This finding underlines the need for better facilities for sample analysis.”

This situation highlights the importance of effective testing protocols for emerging viruses and the need for proper sequencing capabilities to understand the spread of HMPV.
newTitle: Nagpur Kids Test Positive for HMPV at AIIMS, Not Eligible for Genome Sequencing

First phase of Bima Sugam project likely to be rolled out mid-2025 - Business Standard
summary:
First Phase of Bima Sugam Project Likely to be Rolled Out Mid-2025

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The first phase of the Bima Sugam project, designed to create an Amazon-like platform for insurance, is set to be launched in mid-2025 after missing prior deadlines.

  • The project was initially proposed for launch in January 2023.
  • It aims to simplify buying, selling, and servicing of insurance policies.
  • Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (Irdai) chairman Debasish Panda indicated a launch in April 2025, but sources suggest a mid-2025 rollout.
  • The initiative has faced multiple delays since its inception in 2022.
“The idea aims to democratise insurance in India, potentially becoming the first of its kind globally.”

This project is a significant step toward enhancing insurance access and efficiency in India.
newTitle: First Phase of Bima Sugam Project Slated for Mid-2025 Launch

title: HMPV outbreak: Amid global concern, Chinese official says cases in northern China declining - India TV News
summary:
HMPV outbreak: Amid global concern, Chinese official says cases in northern China declining

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Not specified

The recent outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in northern China has sparked concerns about a potential pandemic; however, a health official reports declining rates of infection.

  • The human metapneumovirus, known for causing flu-like symptoms, is not new and has been present for decades.
  • Infections have been rising, but improvements in detection methods have contributed to increased reported cases.
  • Reports indicate that the rate of positive HMPV cases is declining, particularly among children aged 14 and below.
  • Concerns about the outbreak intensified after images of overwhelmed hospitals circulated in media.
  • Experts assert that HMPV differs from COVID-19 in that most people develop some immunity to the virus over time.
“The human metapneumovirus is not a new virus, and has been with humans for at least several decades.” - Wang Liping

As of now, there are no vaccines or specific treatments for HMPV. Experts recommend preventive measures to curb the spread of the virus.
newTitle: HMPV Outbreak Declines in Northern China, Official Reports

title: Box Office: 'Daaku Maharaaj' Opening Day Early Estimates - Sacnilk

Ram Charan and Kiara Advani's film, Game Changer, had a promising start but has seen a decline in box office collections as it concludes its opening weekend.

  • The film collected approximately 7.80-8.20 crores on Day 3, showing about a 7-3% drop from Day 2's 8.43 crores.
  • Total collections for the opening weekend stand between 24.87-25.27 crores.
  • Despite a strong opening, the film's performance is falling short compared to other regional releases, particularly Devara.

“Box office numbers are based on estimates and various sources. Numbers have not been independently verified by Koimoi.”

As the Sankranti holiday approaches, there could be an uptick in viewership, but the film’s fate will depend on its performance during the regular working days that follow.

6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand - The Indian Express
summary:
6 killed after bus plunges 100 metres into gorge in Uttarakhand

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Six people died and several were injured after a private bus fell into a gorge in Uttarakhand’s Pauri Garhwal district on Sunday evening.

  • The bus was carrying 28 passengers from Pauri to Dehalchauri.
  • Emergency services were alerted around 4:30 pm when the bus lost control and fell 100 metres.
  • Rescue work was immediately initiated by the State Disaster Response Force and local police.
  • The injured were taken to a district hospital; some were referred to Srinagar hospital.
  • The deceased included Sunita (25), Pramila, Priyanshu (17), Nagendra, Sulochna, and Prem (70).
“The deeply tragic news of the bus accident... I pray to the Almighty to grant peace to the departed souls and give strength to the grieving families.” - Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami

This tragic accident highlights the risks associated with mountainous travel and the urgency for improved road safety measures in the region.
newTitle: Tragic Bus Accident in Uttarakhand Claims Six Lives

title: Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan’s film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore - The Indian Express
summary:
Game Changer worldwide box office collection Day 2: Ram Charan’s film sees massive dip, collects Rs 72.5 crore

Published on: January 12, 2025, Source: Indian Express

The political action film Game Changer, starring Ram Charan and Kiara Advani, faced a significant decline in box office collections on its second day, totaling Rs 72.5 crore in India.

  • The film earned Rs 51 crore on its opening day.
  • Day 2 saw a dip of 57.84% with a collection of Rs 21.5 crore.
  • The Telugu version grossed Rs 53.95 crore, while the Hindi version brought in Rs 14.5 crore.
  • The film has been accused of inflating its box office numbers.

“The king’s arrival is setting the box office ablaze 🤙🏼 #GameChanger takes a blockbuster opening at the BOX OFFICE 💥💥 GROSSES 186 CRORES WORLDWIDE on Day 1 ❤‍🔥” — Game Changer (@GameChangerOffl)

The film is directed by S Shankar and features a notable cast, including Nassar and Brahmanandam.
newTitle: Game Changer Box Office Collection Shows Significant Dip

Karun Nair went six months without playing to becoming one of the top performers of the Vijay Hazare Trophy — now selectors are interested - The Indian Express
summary:
Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in the Vijay Hazare Trophy

Publication Date: January 2025, Source: The Indian Express

Karun Nair, a notable figure in Indian cricket, has made a stellar comeback after a six-month hiatus from the game, becoming one of the top performers in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. With several centuries to his name, he has drawn the attention of national selectors during a pivotal transitional phase for the Indian Test team.

  • Nair went six months without playing, focusing on improving his skills during this time.
  • He scored his fifth century in the ongoing Vijay Hazare Trophy, helping Vidarbha secure a place in the semi-finals.
  • Despite being overlooked previously, his recent performances have put him back on the selectors' radar.
  • He set a record for the most runs in List A cricket between dismissals, making a remarkable 542 runs before being dismissed.
“Dear cricket, give me one more chance.” — Karun Nair

In summary, Nair's dedication and hard work in overcoming a challenging period have led to significant achievements, demonstrating his potential for a return to the national team.
newTitle: Karun Nair's Remarkable Comeback in the Vijay Hazare Trophy

title: Punjab Kings Announce New Captain For IPL 2025: "We Had Identified..." - NDTV Sports
summary:
Punjab Kings Announce New Captain For IPL 2025: "We Had Identified..."

Date & Source: 26 November 2024, NDTV

The Punjab Kings have officially named Shreyas Iyer as their captain for the upcoming IPL 2025 season, in a unique announcement made by Bollywood star Salman Khan on 'Bigg Boss'.

  • Shreyas Iyer has been chosen as captain after a successful stint in 2024, including victories in the Ranji Trophy and IPL.
  • The decision was publicly made on a popular reality TV show, adding excitement to the announcement.
  • Iyer expressed gratitude and optimism for the future, aiming to help the team secure its first title.
  • Head Coach Ricky Ponting and Punjab Kings CEO Satish Menon highlighted Iyer's proven leadership and vision for the team.
  • Iyer was acquired for a record Rs 26.75 crore, marking him as one of the most expensive players in the IPL auction.
“I am honoured that the team has reposed its faith in me. ... I hope to repay the faith shown by the management to deliver our maiden title.” – Shreyas Iyer

Punjab Kings are optimistic about their season ahead with a strong combination of experienced and young talent under Iyer's leadership.
newTitle: Punjab Kings Name Shreyas Iyer as Captain for IPL 2025

summary:

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: Indian Express

All roads in Uttar Pradesh’s Prayagraj lead to the Ganga, especially these days as the Maha Kumbh, a mela hosted here every 12 years, opens its portals on January 13.

  • Hundreds of boats with devotees make continuous circuits of the Triveni Sangam, the confluence of the Ganga, the Yamuna, and the mythical Saraswati.
  • A panoramic photograph of the shore, the brightly painted boats, and the sea of devotees forms a vibrant scene at the river.
This article went live on January twelfth, twenty twenty-five, at thirty-one minutes past five in the evening.

title: Bangladesh summons Indian envoy over border tensions - The Indian Express
summary:
Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: Indian Express

Bangladesh expressed its concerns to India regarding border security and recent actions by the Border Security Force (BSF) that have escalated tensions along the Indo-Bangla border.

  • Bangladesh summoned Indian High Commissioner Pranay Verma to discuss border tensions.
  • Allegations were made that India attempted to construct fences at five locations along the border.
  • The Indian envoy emphasized cooperation between BSF and Bangladesh's Border Guard.
  • Recent incidents, including a citizen's killing by BSF, heightened concerns.
  • Bangladesh aims to resolve issues through dialogue rather than conflict.
“Unauthorized attempts to construct fences undermine the spirit of cooperation and friendly relations between the two neighboring countries.” - Bangladesh Foreign Secretary Jashim Uddin

This meeting reflects the ongoing challenges in Indo-Bangladesh relations, emphasizing the need for continued dialogue over border security issues.
newTitle: Bangladesh Summons Indian Envoy Over Border Tensions

title: Historic planet parade on Jan 25: NASA's 2025 sky guide and how to watch - WION
summary:
Historic Planet Parade on January 25: NASA's 2025 Sky Guide and How to Watch

Publication Date: June 2023

Source: NASA

This January, the night sky offers a rare treat: a parade of four bright planets visible at the same time after sunset. Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars align along the ecliptic, creating a stunning celestial display.

To catch the planet parade, head outside after dark and look southwest to spot Venus and Saturn nearby, with Jupiter high overhead and Mars rising in the east.

  • Find a spot away from city lights to avoid light pollution.
  • Dress warmly, as January nights can be chilly.
  • Use binoculars or a telescope to enhance your view of Mars, Venus, and Saturn.
  • Be patient and allow your eyes to adjust to the dark.
  • Take a star map or use a skywatching app to help identify planets and constellations.

The Quadrantid meteor shower peaks on January 3, offering up to 30 meteors per hour under ideal conditions. Venus and Saturn will come close on January 17-18, appearing only two degrees apart. Mars will shine bright as it’s at opposition this month, making it an excellent target for observation.

“On January 13, the full Moon will pass in front of Mars, creating an unforgettable sight for skywatchers.”

Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to witness the beauty of our solar system!
newTitle: Historic Planet Parade on January 25: NASA's 2025 Sky Guide and How to Watch

title: In challenge to Amit Shah, Kejriwal says won’t contest Delhi polls if Centre assures houses for all slum-dwellers in court - The Indian Express
summary:
Kejriwal Challenges Amit Shah on Slum Housing Commitment in Delhi Elections

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has issued a direct challenge to Union Home Minister Amit Shah regarding the future of slum-dwellers in Delhi. He stated he would not contest the upcoming elections unless the central government assures the rehabilitation of slum residents and withdraws cases related to demolition.

  • Kejriwal claims to be the protector of slum residents and criticizes BJP for only addressing slum issues during elections.
  • He stated the BJP has only built 4,000 houses for slum-dwellers, while Delhi has over four lakh slums.
  • Kejriwal offered a challenge to Amit Shah, emphasizing the need for an affidavit to assure housing for the evicted slum-dwellers.
  • He expressed concerns that the BJP's plans will lead to mass demolitions if they win the elections.
“If you vote for BJP, it will be like signing your own suicide note.”

Kejriwal's statements highlight the ongoing struggle for housing and the political maneuvering surrounding upcoming elections in Delhi.
newTitle: Kejriwal Challenges Amit Shah on Slum Housing Commitment in Delhi Elections
